ref: 12958a †sáṁbādhatē ʻ presses down or together ʼ AV., ʻ oppresses, torments ʼ R. 2. †saṁbādhá -- m. ʻ distress ʼ RV., ʻ thronging, jostling ʼ Kāv. (also wr. saṁvādha -- ), saṁbādhanā -- f. ʻ chafing ʼ Siṁhās. [Spelt saṁvāhayati ʻ rubs ʼ Āpast., saṁvavāhatuḥ pf. MBh., saṁvāha -- m. (MārkP.), saṁvāhana -- n. (Suśr.) ʻ shampooing the body ʼ. Cf. EWA ii 428. -- √bādh]
Pa. sambādhati ʻ is crowded ʼ, sambāhati ʻ rubs, shampoos ʼ,
Si. ham̆banavā, am̆b˚ ʻ to rub, massage ʼ DSL 572.
